symptomProgression.description: Acute onset with high fever and systemic symptoms

doctorInstructions: Rest in bed and avoid strenuous activity
Drink plenty of fluids: water, clear broths, herbal teas
Take acetaminophen (Tylenol) 500mg every 6 hours for fever/pain
Use throat lozenges or hard candy for sore throat relief
Use humidifier to keep air moist
Wash hands frequently to prevent spreading infection
Use separate towels and utensils while symptomatic
Contact doctor if fever persists >3 days or exceeds 103°F
Return to work/school only after fever-free for 24 hours
Complete full course of any prescribed antibiotics if bacterial
Use saline nasal spray for congestion
Elevate head while sleeping to reduce post-nasal drip
Avoid alcohol and caffeine which can dehydrate

complicationsTimeline.action: Monitor closely, contact doctor if worsening

redFlagSymptoms: Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath
Signs of dehydration: dry mouth, decreased urination
Cough with blood or green/yellow sputum

dailyCheckInQuestions: On a scale of 0-10, how severe is your sore throat?
How would you rate your fatigue level today?
Do you have any nasal congestion or runny nose?
Have you experienced any cough today?
How much fluid have you consumed today?
Have you taken your fever-reducing medication as prescribed?
Are you experiencing any body aches or chills?
How many hours of sleep did you get last night?
Do you have any headache or ear pain?
